name: Mount Jefferson

current_conditions.ai_summary: A rugged and imposing peak in the Presidential Range. The Caps Ridge Trail is the highest trailhead in NH, offering a head start.

generated_description:
The Experience

Mount Jefferson offers some of the best views of Mount Washington and the Great Gulf Wilderness. The ascent via Caps Ridge is a fun, hands-on scramble over rock formations known as 'The Caps'.

The Challenge

Although shorter than other Presidential climbs, it is steep and relentless. The rock scrambling requires agility and confidence.

Local Insight

Jefferson Notch Road is closed in winter. The Six Husbands Trail is a terrifying alternative for thrill-seekers.

trails_config.name: Caps Ridge Trail
trails_config.description: Starting at Jefferson Notch, this is the shortest route to a major Presidential peak. Features hands-on scrambling on the 'Caps'.
trails_config.parking_info: Caps Ridge Trailhead, Jefferson Notch Rd

trails_config.name: Six Husbands Trail
trails_config.description: Leads through Great Gulf Wilderness and up a cliffside using wooden ladders and tight rock chimneys.
trails_config.parking_info: Great Gulf Trailhead, NH-16, Gorham, NH

ui_alert.title: Extreme Difficulty
ui_alert.message: This trail contains ladders and tight squeezes. Not recommended for dogs or those with large packs.

ui_alert.title: Extreme Difficulty
ui_alert.message: This trail contains ladders and tight squeezes. Not recommended for dogs or those with large packs.
